Abstract: Lung cell atlases, constructed using single-cell RNA sequencing, offer unprecedented insights into the cellular landscape of the respiratory system in both health and disease. This research explores the application of these atlases in understanding complex pulmonary conditions such as pulmonary fibrosis, emphysema, asthma, and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS). By delineating cell-type-specific gene expression profiles, these atlases facilitate the identification of novel biomarkers and therapeutic targets. The study highlights the potential of single-cell technologies to unravel the heterogeneity of lung diseases, providing a comprehensive framework for personalized medicine approaches. This work underscores the transformative impact of lung cell atlases in advancing our understanding of respiratory pathophysiology and improving clinical outcomes.
